title: travelplanner: Can you devise a week-long travel plan for a solo traveler? The trip takes off from Columbus and involves visiting 3 distinct cities in Texas from March 1st to March 7th, 2022. The budget for this venture is set at $4,200. (0b47f60d2298e352)

always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan!

chat_history.name: flight_search

chat_history.content:
Here's a suggested 7-day itinerary for a solo trip to Texas, within your budget:

## Day 1 - March 1st
- Fly from Columbus to Dallas. Flight options include:
  - Flight F3666359, departing at 07:19 and arriving at 09:00, costs $208.
  - Flight F3712939, departing at 11:45 and arriving at 13:22, costs $374.
  - Flight F3721071, departing at 18:00 and arriving at 19:35, costs $336.
  - Flight F3800981, departing at 07:41 and arriving at 09:13, is the most affordable option at $160.

## Day 1 - Dallas
- Spend the day exploring Dallas. Consider visiting the Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden, a 66-acre botanical garden with seasonal displays and themed gardens.
- For dinner, try the local Tex-Mex cuisine at a restaurant like El Fenix, a historic establishment known for its traditional flavours.

## Day 2 - March 2nd
- Continue your exploration of Dallas. Visit the Sixth Floor Museum at Dealey Plaza, which chronicles the life and assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
- In the evening, head to the arts district for a performance at the AT&T Performing Arts Center or a concert at the Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Center.

## Day 3 - March 3rd
- Fly from Dallas to Houston. Numerous flight options are available throughout the day, with prices ranging from $50 to $121. Here are some recommendations:
  - Flight F3902451 departing at 14:26 and arriving at 15:11, is one of the most affordable choices at $50.
  - Flight F3902687, departing at 18:12 and arriving at 18:56, costs $63.
  - Flight F4046233, departing at 19:07 and arriving at 20:30, offers a slightly longer journey at $50.

## Day 3 - Houston
- Arrive in Houston and check into your accommodation.
- Visit the Space Center Houston, an official NASA visitor centre, to learn about space exploration and see spacecraft exhibits.
- Enjoy dinner at a renowned restaurant like Hugo's, serving upscale Mexican cuisine with a focus on regional dishes.

## Day 4 - March 4th
- Explore more of Houston. Start your day at the Houston Museum of Natural Science, housing extensive exhibits on various scientific topics.
- In the afternoon, stroll through Hermann Park, a vast urban park with walking trails, gardens, and attractions like the Houston Zoo.

## Day 5 - March 5th
- Fly from Houston to Austin. There are several flights to choose from, with prices between $28 and $72. Consider:
  - Flight F3902876, departing at 21:18 and arriving at 22:10, costs $37.
  - Flight F3931894, departing at 12:11 and arriving at 13:06, is a reasonable option at $28.
  - Flight F3971576, departing at 10:46 and arriving at 11:27, costs $72.

## Day 5 - Austin
- After arriving in Austin, settle into your accommodation.
- Visit the Texas State Capitol, a historic landmark and the seat of government, offering tours and a glimpse into Texas history.
- In the evening, explore the vibrant nightlife along Sixth Street, known for its live music venues and diverse culinary scene.

## Day 6 - March 6th
- Explore Austin further. Start your day at the Lady Bird Lake Hike and Bike Trail, enjoying a scenic walk or bike ride along the lake.
- Visit the South Congress Avenue, a vibrant shopping and dining district known for its eclectic stores and iconic landmarks like the South Congress Bridge Bats.

## Day 7 - March 7th
- Prepare for your departure or extend your stay and explore more of Austin's attractions, such as the Bullock Texas State History Museum or the Blanton Museum of Art.

Your total estimated expenditure for flights is $575, leaving you with a significant portion of your budget for accommodation, meals, transportation, and activities.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
